title: For Sale:  Insight AN/PEQ-2A IR Aiming Laser
postcontent:
The AN/PEQ-2A Infrared Target Pointer/Illuminator/Aiming Laser, (ITPIAL),
P/N ITP-500C incorporates lessons learned with Aiming Lights in Desert Storm, other combat operations, and extensive field evaluation, plus production experience with over 50,000 US Military standard aiming lights. The result is a dual beam multi-function laser, which combines the utility and operational effectiveness of aiming lights and illuminator/pointers in a singe device.


Separate Aiming and Illuminator Beams. Both beams are adjustable in elevation and windage.
Aim spot can be centered in illumination area.
Illumination beam is able to focus from a pinpoint spot to wide-angle flood.
Pointer ranges can exceed 10 miles.
Various diffusers available for customized light shaping.
Compact, Durable, and Lightweight.
Uses 2 AA batteries.
Waterproof to 66 feet.
Meets all military environmental requirements
Operation
The ITPIAL features a unique switching capability for both gun mounted and hand
held operation. A fully integrated low profile Mode Selector Switch is conveniently
located for ambidextrous operation and is designed for ease of use even under zero light conditions. The switch allows the operator to select one of six modes:
AN/PEQ-2
OFF
AIM – LOW
AIM – HI
ILLUMINATOR
DUAL-LOW
DUAL-HIGH

The AN/PEQ-2A model incorporates a safety block over the switch that prevents the user from switching the mode switch into High Power.

Low power is eye safe* and is useful for force on force training and to preclude blooming in close combat engagements, while high power enables engagements or training at extended range and in high light conditions. The Infrared Target Illuminator/Pointer/Aiming Laser beam can be adjusted from a 0.5-mrad beam for long range pointing to a 10° circular illumination beam. A variety of lights shaping diffusers are available for creating wider illumination angles.
The ITPIAL is the only device of its kind to have two independently adjustable beams.
The ITPIAL has two sets of Azimuth and Elevation adjusters that allow the operator independent adjustment of both laser beams.

The ITPIAL is equipped with an integral push button FIRE switch, which provides convenient operation in the hand held mode. This single button switch enables the
operator to activate the ITPIAL in either momentary or steady on modes.
When weapon mounted the ITPIAL can be activated using a variety of remote switches.

Depending on the weapon and the preference of the user, “push button” or membrane remotes of various lengths can be supplied. All switches quickly attach to the weapon and provide for convenient fingertip operation of the system, and all switches withstand demanding military environments.

Performance
The ITPIAL is a highly durable, lightweight device manufactured with advanced engineering polymers and composites for maximum utility and durability.
The ITPIAL incorporates an advanced electro-optical system comprised of two index
guided laser diodes, diffraction limited micro-lens assemblies, and unique full logic microprocessor controlled electronic drivers.

Weapon Attachment
The ITPIAL is easily attached to all US Military Standard direct fire weapons and the AT4 Rocket Launcher with standard brackets. The ITPIAL attaches to the various brackets with a single thumbscrew. The ITPIAL can be removed and reinstalled on its bracket without loss of zero.

Contact joe 510-20zero-618zero

The SU-16 has a conventional, long-stroke gas-piston operation and utilizes the proven Johnson/Stoner breech locking system. It is compatible with standard AR-15/M-16 magazines. The reciprocating bolt handle and magazine catch are on the right side, while the push bolt safety can be changed to work from either side. Except for barrel and operating components, the SU-16 is made entirely of high impact reinforced polymer. Hand guards turn into bipod. Had 2-10rd internally stored mag and 2-20rd pmags. Upgraded take down pin with single point sling attachment. Great backpack gun.

title: For Sale:  Marlin 1895M Rifle W/Reloading supplies
postcontent:
I have an immaculate Marlin model 1895M for sale. The rifle is chambered in .450 Marlin, essentially a magnum version of the venerable .45-70 Govt. cartridge. Factory ammo will launch a 325 or 350 gr. projectile at about 2200 fps. This cartridge was developed with stopping charging grizzly bears in mind, but with handloading .45-70 ballistics can be simulated making it suitable for deer and elk, or maybe buffalo ;) 

I purchased the gun new in 2007 and it has had about 150 rounds through it. At 7.5 lb. and only 37" long it is super easy to carry in the woods. A small stick, with a very large thump! 

For the Rifle, completele with box/papers, and a fresh box of 325 gr. Leverevolution ammo $550

For $800 you get the rifle and I'll also include my reloading stash for the gun. It includes 1 2/3 pounds of powder, 300-400 large rifle primers, hundreds of once fired brass, Hornady dies, and about 200 assorted projectiles in 300 gr. HP, 325 gr. Leverevolution, and 350 gr. FN. 

I will not sell any or all of the reloading components without selling the rifle, please don't ask.

********** Please reply with a first name and phone number so I can separate the real people from the scams. Thanks.************

title: For Sale:  Remington 700 BDL Anniversary Edition
postcontent:
Remington Model 700 BDL 200 year Anniversary 30-06, Absolutely Spectacularly figured Maple Stock, NIB! 

This rifle has never been fired and includes factory box. 

This is the very desirable, nearly impossible to find new, very limited edition Remington Model 700 200 year anniversary of Eliphalet Remington in 30-06 with a 22" barrel made in 1993 and carefully vault stored ever since. To celebrate the 200th Anniversary, Remington pulled out all the stops and fitted a collectors grade stock on this rifle in truly spectacular, ultra highly figured fiddleback maple finished in unstained natural maple high gloss finish with a Monte Carlo comb with raised cheekpiece, generous skip line cut checkering both on the pistol grip and for end, black caps on the for end, pistol grip and on the butt stock which wears the Remington logo. 

The pictures simply can't show the true beauty of the wood. The stock has a 3D, holographic effect to the exquisite fiddleback grain as you look at it from different angles. The rifle includes a Leupold Vari X II 3-9x40 scope. Being a Model 700 BDL it has the factory Remington open sights installed with the front having a removable hood and the rear being adjustable for windage and elevation. Featuring a forged action and fore-end assembly crafted from a high tech aluminum alloy, the Tempio Light combines featherweight lightness for carrying and handling ease with unmatched durability and function. title: For Sale:  KAHR P380 BLACK DIAMOND 380ACP PISTOL - NEW (Factory Fired Only)
postcontent:
For sale is a Kahr P380 Black Diamond model KP3834 which I purchased as a backup and has never been fired except at the factory.

It is marked as a factory test fire (from the Kahr website: Q. What does the "U" on the trigger guard of my pistol mean? A. If there is a "U" engraved on the trigger guard of your pistol, it is a factory refurbished and test fired model (often sold as a "test fired" gun). From what I understand, Kahr pulls some assembled pistols off the assembly line, fires them and marks them as a factory test fire. The advantage is the break in process is already started and you get a new condition pistol at a discounted price. 

It is in the factory box just like you would get a new one. There are no scratches or any marks on the pistol other than the barrel hood which indicates it has been fired at the factory.

Visit http://civilresponse.eventbrite.com for our full schedule or to register for a class.

Our class is designed for citizens with all levels of firearms experience, from beginners to military veterans.  We encourage participation and questions from all students during the class so that everyone can learn together. Students are required to complete a state mandated brief shooting exercise that demonstrates the ability to safely control and fire a handgun at typical self defense distance of approximately 10-15 yards. Even if you never plan on carrying a firearm, our class has valuable information on how you can prevent a violent encounter in the first place, as well as alternatives to carrying a firearm.

Your Satisfaction Is Guaranteed!
We want to meet and exceed your expectations. If upon completing the class you feel we did not give you the information you need to be a safe and responsible legally armed citizen, you owe us nothing, period. Receiving your certificate your acknowledgement that we've met or exceeded your expectations and that you are satisfied with our services. It is also our acknowledgement that we believe you have completed the course and demonstrated the ability to handle, load, unload, and shoot a firearm safely at the time of class.

Cost: $75 Payable at the end of class.
We accept cash, check and credit cards.

title: For Sale:  Browning 1885
location: Windsor Bear Arms, Fort Collins, Colorado
postcontent:
In 1878, the 23-year-old Browning designed a falling-block single shot rifle, for which he was granted a patent the following year. Browning and his brother commenced making the rifles by hand in their second-floor workshop in Ogden, Utah, with limited success.
In 1883, Thomas G. Bennett, Vice-President and General Manager of the Winchester Repeating Arms Company, traveled to Ogden and negotiated the purchase of the single-shot design, as well as the prototype of what would become the Model 1886 lever-action – the beginning of the fruitful 20-year Winchester-Browning collaboration. Winchester's engineers made some improvements to Browning's design, including angling the block at six degrees to create a positive breech seal, and released the rifle as the Model 1885. Two popular models were made, the so-called Low Wall which showed an exposed hammer, firing less powerful cartridges, and the so-called High Wall for stronger cartridges whose steel frame covered most of the firing hammer when viewed from the side; but both were officially marketed by Winchester as the Single Shot Rifle.
It was produced principally to satisfy the demands of the growing sport of long-range "Match Shooting", which opened at Creedmoor, New York, on June 21, 1872. Target/Match shooting was extremely popular in the US from about 1871 until about 1917, enjoying a status similar to golf today, and the Winchester company, which had built its reputation on repeating firearms, had in 1885 challenged the single shot giants of Sharps, Remington, Stevens, Maynard, Ballard[disambiguation needed] et al., not only entering the competition, but excelling at it, with Major Ned H. Roberts (inventor of the .257 Roberts cartridge) describing the Model 1885 Single Shot as "the most reliable, strongest, and altogether best single shot rifle ever produced."[1]

Bear Arms
1292 Main St #4
Windsor, CO 80550
REDACTED
beararmscolorado.com

title: For Sale/Trade:  Off-Road Hauler 4800 Lifted Golf / Utility Cart
location: Chesapeake - Great Bridge, Hampton Roads, Virginia
postcontent:
Designed for bigger jobs on rough terrain, the 2WD Hauler 4800 offers a powerful 16 HP engine coupled to a CVT transmission with a locking rear differential. With a roto-molded cargo box, 800 lb. payload capacity, 20-inch tires and hydraulic brakes, the ST 480 is equipped to deliver work-ready performance and dependability.

 Specifications: Gas Only
•Engine: Briggs & Stratton Vanguard 16.0 hp (The biggest available in the light utility line)
•Batteries: One 12-volt maintenance free
•Fuel capacity: 6.7 gallon
•Frame: Welded steel
•Lights: Installed
•Cargo Box: 44" x 36" x 10.5" Roto-Molded Polyethylene (5.9 cu ft capacity)
•Tires: Turf Saver 20 x 10 - 10
•Fronts suspension: Leaf springs w/hydraulic shocks
•Rear suspension: Leaf springs w/hydraulic shocks
•Service Brake: Rear wheel mechanical drum
•Load capacity: 800 lb
•Power electric dump
•Roof & Brush Guard

Cart is a 2005 that shows signs of use and wear. Runs well. It was given a quick once over with most of the exposed black frame and other black parts painted and clear coated. It's ready to be customized or used as it is. Higher load capacity will allow you more flexibility in customizing this cart.

Two front tires are good and two rear tires will need to be replaced. 20 inch tires run about $65. You can go up to 22 inch tires without changing any suspension.

The orange body panels have scratches from use and two areas damaged by heat. 

Email me with questions, more photos or to schedule a test drive.  If this ad is still up, the cart is still available. Local buyers only. I can deliver if necessary.

title: For Sale:  AK-47, unknown varient, project (shoots but jams)
postcontent:
*Note - to be sold as parts kit, disassembled prior to transaction, per ATF rules*

I have an AK47 "project" that I'd like to sell. I'm not well versed in gunsmith work and do not have the tools, nor know what I need to know to repair it. A friend built it years ago, I've only put about 40 rounds through it in all this time.  No rust. The issue is that it jams on extraction. It is accurate, but jams every round. A similar unit built with same parts had the extractor filed and it functioned 100% after this. I don't have the equipment to do this, or knowledge and can't seem to find a gunsmith in my vicinity who can.  It has a Tapco trigger, the stock is from my Saiga 762. Comes with 30 round mags, 3 of them. Asking $300.  With a little work this could be worth a lot more.  Reach me at REDACTED

Note on manufacturer - I'm not completely sure it is a Zastava.
